title: Seeing Beneath Dense Forest Canopies
subtitle: Under-Canopy Terrain Reconstruction in Dense Forests Using RGB Imaging and Neural 3D Reconstruction
description: CV4EO workshop paper from the Forest Vision Lab presenting under-canopy terrain reconstruction in dense forests.
abstract: We present a study on reconstructing under-canopy terrain in dense forest environments using RGB imaging and neural 3D reconstruction. This placeholder abstract can be replaced with the final text before submission.
contributions: Introduce a pipeline for under-canopy terrain reconstruction tailored to dense forest imagery.
Provide a benchmark dataset and evaluation protocol for RGB-based forest terrain recovery.
Demonstrate improvements over classical baselines with neural 3D reconstruction techniques.

videos.title: Under-Canopy Flight
videos.caption: Example RGB flight and generated terrain model.

videos.title: Comparative Results
videos.caption: Comparison between baselines and CV4EO approach.

acknowledgements: We thank the Forest Vision Lab collaborators and the CV4EO workshop organizers.

contact.note: For questions about CV4EO, reach out to the Forest Vision Lab.
